Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; traces of added white bands at the top of sherd and again possibly lower down at bottom of sherd; exterior: painted decoration consisting of head, neck, shoulder and foreleg of grazing goat to right; at right, hind leg of second goat, to right; part of rising roundel as filling ornament; below, trace of single horizontal line.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis) (on Petrie 1886, pl. V)
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices, but dated later than those chalices because she considers the style of the drawing to be debased and because of the elementary and isolated interior decoration (Lemos 1991, 72-3).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pp. 50-1, pl. V, no. 52)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 251, no. 372, pl. 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0171) (phase 2)
